1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdModule.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	The actual module command from the Tcl level. This   **
15   |  **			routines calls other ModuleCmd routines to carry out **
16   |  **			the subcommand requested. 			     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdModule					     **
19   |  **			Read_Modulefile					     **
20   |  **			Execute_TclFile					     **
21   |  **			CallModuleProcedure				     **
22   |  ** 									     **
23   |  **   Notes:								     **
24   |  ** 									     **
25   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
26   |  ****/
27   | 
28   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
29   |  ** 									     **
30   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
31   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
32   |  ** 									     ** 
33   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
34   | 
35   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdModule.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
36   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
37   | 
38   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
39   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
40   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
41   | 
42   | #include "modules_def.h"
43   | 
44   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
45   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | 
48   | /** not applicable **/
49   | 
50   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
51   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | 
54   | /** not applicable **/
55   | 
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | 
60   | /** not applicable **/
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | char	_fil_stdin[] = "stdin";
67   | char	_fil_stdout[] = "stdout";
68   | char	_fil_stderr[] = "stderr";
69   | char	_fil_devnull[] = "/dev/null";
70   | int	linenum = 0;
71   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
72   | char	 *module_command;
73   | 
74   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
75   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
76   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
77   | 
78   | /** not applicable **/
79   | 
80   | 
81   | /*++++
82   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
83   |  ** 									     **
84   |  **   Function:		cmdModule					     **
85   |  ** 									     **
86   |  **   Description:	Evaluation of the module command line and callup of  **
87   |  **			the according subroutine			     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
92   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
93   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
94   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
97   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
98   |  ** 									     **
99   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
100  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
101  |  **					control everything		     **
102  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
103  |  **						by the current command	     **
104  |  ** 									     **
105  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
106  |  ++++*/
107  | 
108  | int cmdModule(
109  | 	ClientData client_data,
110  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
111  | 	int objc,
112  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
113  | ) {
114  | 	int             return_val = -1,	/** exit return value	     **/
115  | 	    store_flags = g_flags,		/** local copy of flags	     **/
116  | 	    match = 0,				/** found match		     **/
117  | 	    i;
118  | 	char           *store_curmodule = NULL,	/** current module name	     **/
119  | 	    *save_module_command = NULL;	/** save module command	     **/
120  |     /**
121  |      **  These skip the arguments past the shell and command.
122  |      **/
123  | 	int             num_modulefiles = objc - 2;
124  | 	char          **modulefile_list;
125  | 	int             argc;
126  | 
127  | #if 0
128  | 	int             x = 0;
129  | #  define _XD	fprintf(stderr,":%d:",++x),
130  | #else
131  | #  define _XD
132  | #endif
133  | 
134  | #define	_MTCH	_XD match =
135  | #define	_ISERR	((match == -1) && (*TCL_RESULT(interp)))
136  | #define _TCLCHK(a) {if(_ISERR) ErrorLogger(ERR_EXEC,LOC,TCL_RESULT(a),NULL);}
137  | 
138  |     /**
139  |      **  Help or whatis mode?
140  |      **/
141  | 	if (g_flags & (M_HELP | M_WHATIS))
142  | 		return (TCL_OK);
143  |     /**
144  |      **  Parameter check
145  |      **/
146  | 	if (objc < 2) {
147  | 		(void)ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, "module", " command ",
148  | 				  " [arguments ...] ", NULL);
149  | 		(void)ModuleCmd_Help(interp, 0, NULL);
150  | 		return (TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
151  | 	}
152  |     /**
153  |      **  Non-persist mode?
154  |      **/
155  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
156  | 		return (TCL_OK);
157  | 	}
158  |     /**
159  |      **  Display whatis mode?
160  |      **/
161  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
162  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
163  | 		for (i = 1; i < objc; i++)
164  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(objv[i]));
165  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
166  | 		return (TCL_OK);
167  | 	}
168  |     /**
169  |      **  For recursion.  This can be called multiple times.
170  |      **/
171  | 	save_module_command = module_command;
172  | 	module_command = stringer(NULL, 0, Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), NULL);
173  | 
174  | 	if (g_current_module)
175  | 		store_curmodule = g_current_module;
176  | 
177  | 	/* convert the modulefile_list from Objv to Argv to pass along */
178  | 	Tcl_ObjvToArgv(&argc, &modulefile_list, objc - 2, objv + 2);
179  | 
180  |     /**
181  |      **  If the command is '-', we want to just start 
182  |      **    interpreting Tcl from stdin.
183  |      **/
184  | 	if (_XD ! strcmp(module_command, "-")) {
185  | 		return_val = Execute_TclFile(interp, _fil_stdin);
186  |     /**
187  |      **  Evaluate the module command and call the according subroutine
188  |      **  --- module LOAD|ADD
189  |      **/
190  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, addRE))) {
191  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
192  | 		return_val =
193  | 		    ModuleCmd_Load(interp, 1, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
194  |        /**
195  |         **  We always say the load succeeded.  ModuleCmd_Load will
196  |         **  output any necessary error messages.
197  |         **/
198  | 		return_val = TCL_OK;
199  |     /**
200  |      **  --- module UNLOAD
201  |      **/
202  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, rmRE))) {
203  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
204  | 		ModuleCmd_Load(interp, 0, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
205  | 		return_val = TCL_OK;
206  |     /**
207  |      **  --- module SWITCH
208  |      **/
209  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, swRE))) {
210  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
211  | 		return_val =
212  | 		    ModuleCmd_Switch(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
213  |     /**
214  |      **  --- module DISPLAY
215  |      **/
216  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, dispRE))) {
217  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
218  | 		return_val =
219  | 		    ModuleCmd_Display(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
220  |     /**
221  |      **  --- module LIST
222  |      **/
223  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, listRE))) {
224  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
225  | 		if (!(sw_format & SW_SET)) {	/* default format options */
226  | 			sw_format |= (SW_HUMAN | SW_TERSE);
227  | 			sw_format &= ~(SW_PARSE | SW_LONG);
228  | 		}
229  | 		/* use SW_LIST to indicate LIST & not AVAIL */
230  | 		sw_format |= SW_LIST;
231  | 		return_val =
232  | 		    ModuleCmd_List(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
233  |     /**
234  |      **  --- module AVAIL
235  |      **/
236  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, availRE))) {
237  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
238  | 		if (!(sw_format & SW_SET)) {	/* default format options */
239  | 			sw_format |= (SW_HUMAN | SW_TERSE);
240  | 			sw_format &= ~(SW_PARSE | SW_LONG);
241  | 		}
242  | 		/* use SW_LIST to indicate LIST & not AVAIL */
243  | 		sw_format &= ~SW_LIST;
244  | 		return_val =
245  | 		    ModuleCmd_Avail(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
246  |     /**
247  |      **  --- module WHATIS and APROPOS
248  |      **/
249  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, whatisRE))) {
250  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
251  | 		return_val =
252  | 		    ModuleCmd_Whatis(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
253  | 
254  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, aproposRE))) {
255  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
256  | 		return_val =
257  | 		    ModuleCmd_Apropos(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
258  |     /**
259  |      **  --- module CLEAR
260  |      **/
261  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, clearRE))) {
262  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
263  | 		return_val =
264  | 		    ModuleCmd_Clear(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
265  |     /**
266  |      **  --- module UPDATE
267  |      **/
268  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, updateRE))) {
269  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
270  | 		return_val =
271  | 		    ModuleCmd_Update(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
272  |     /**
273  |      **  --- module PURGE
274  |      **/
275  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, purgeRE))) {
276  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
277  | 		return_val =
278  | 		    ModuleCmd_Purge(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
279  |     /**
280  |      **  --- module INIT
281  |      **/
282  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, initRE))) {
283  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
284  | 
285  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^inita|^ia")) {
286  | 			/* initadd */
287  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
288  | 			g_flags |= M_LOAD;
289  | 			return_val =
290  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
291  | 					   modulefile_list);
292  | 			g_flags &= ~M_LOAD;
293  | 		}
294  | 
295  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^initr|^iw")) {
296  | 			/* initrm */
297  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
298  | 			g_flags |= M_REMOVE;
299  | 			return_val =
300  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
301  | 					   modulefile_list);
302  | 			g_flags &= ~M_REMOVE;
303  | 		}
304  | 
305  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^initl|^il")) {
306  | 			/* initlist */
307  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
308  | 			g_flags |= M_DISPLAY;
309  | 			return_val =
310  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
311  | 					   modulefile_list);
312  | 			g_flags &= ~M_DISPLAY;
313  | 		}
314  | 
315  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^inits|^is")) {
316  | 			/* initswitch */
317  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
318  | 			g_flags |= M_SWITCH;
319  | 			return_val =
320  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
321  | 					   modulefile_list);
322  | 			g_flags &= ~M_SWITCH;
323  | 		}
324  | 
325  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^initc|^ic")) {
326  | 			/* initclear */
327  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
328  | 			g_flags |= M_CLEAR;
329  | 			return_val =
330  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
331  | 					   modulefile_list);
332  | 			g_flags &= ~M_CLEAR;
333  | 		}
334  | 
335  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, "^initp|^ip")) {
336  | 			/*initprepend */
337  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
338  | 			g_flags |= (M_PREPEND | M_LOAD);
339  | 			return_val =
340  | 			    ModuleCmd_Init(interp, num_modulefiles,
341  | 					   modulefile_list);
342  | 			g_flags &= ~(M_PREPEND | M_LOAD);
343  | 		}
344  |     /**
345  |      **  --- module USE
346  |      **/
347  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, useRE))) {
348  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
349  | 		return_val =
350  | 		    ModuleCmd_Use(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
351  |     /**
352  |      **  --- module UNUSE
353  |      **/
354  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, unuseRE))) {
355  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
356  | 		return_val =
357  | 		    ModuleCmd_UnUse(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
358  |     /**
359  |      **  --- module REFRESH 
360  |      **/
361  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, refreshRE))) {
362  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
363  | 		return_val =
364  | 		    ModuleCmd_Refresh(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
365  |     /**
366  |      **  --- module HELP
367  |      **/
368  | 	} else if ((_MTCH Tcl_RegExpMatch(interp, module_command, helpRE))) {
369  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
370  | 		return_val =
371  | 		    ModuleCmd_Help(interp, num_modulefiles, modulefile_list);
372  | 	}
373  |     /**
374  |      **  Evaluate the subcommands return value in order to get rid of unrecog-
375  |      **  nized commands
376  |      **/
377  | 	if (return_val < 0)
378  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_COMMAND, LOC, module_command, NULL))
379  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
380  |     /**
381  |      **  Clean up from recursion
382  |      **/
383  | 	g_flags = store_flags;
384  | 	if (store_curmodule)
385  | 		g_current_module = store_curmodule;
386  | 
387  | 	module_command = save_module_command;
388  | 
389  |     /**
390  |      **  Return on success
391  |      **/
392  | 	return (return_val);
393  | 
394  | } /** End of 'cmdModule' **/
395  | 
396  | /*++++
397  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
398  |  ** 									     **
399  |  **   Function:		Read_Modulefile					     **
400  |  ** 									     **
401  |  **   Description:	Check the passed filename for to be a valid module   **
402  |  **			and execute the according command file		     **
403  |  ** 									     **
404  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
405  |  ** 									     **
406  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
407  |  **		 	char		*filename			     **
408  |  ** 									     **
409  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
410  |  **				TCL_BREAK	break command		     **
411  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
412  |  ** 									     **
413  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
414  |  ** 									     **
415  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
416  |  ++++*/
417  | 
418  | int   Read_Modulefile( Tcl_Interp	*interp, 
419  | 		       char		*filename)
420  | {
421  |     int    result;
422  | 
423  |     /**
424  |      **  Parameter check. A valid filename is to be given.
425  |      **/
426  |     if( !filename) {
427  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "filename", NULL))
428  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
429  |     }
430  | 
431  |     /**
432  |      **  Check for the module 'magic cookie'
433  |      **  Trust stdin as a valid module file ...
434  |      **/
435  |     
436  |     if( !strcmp( filename, _fil_stdin) && !check_magic( filename,
437  |     	MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
438  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, filename, NULL))
439  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
440  |     }
441  | 
442  |     /**
443  |      **  Now do execute that module file and evaluate the result of the
444  |      **  latest executed command
445  |      **/
446  | 
447  |     result = Execute_TclFile(interp, filename);
448  | 
449  |     /**
450  |      **  Return the result as derivered from the module file execution
451  |      **/
452  |     return( result);
453  | 
454  | } /** End of 'Read_Modulefile' **/
455  | 
456  | /*++++
457  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
458  |  ** 									     **
459  |  **   Function:		Execute_TclFile					     **
460  |  ** 									     **
461  |  **   Description:	Read in and execute all commands concerning the Tcl  **
462  |  **			file passed as parameter			     **
463  |  ** 									     **
464  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
465  |  ** 									     **
466  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
467  |  **		 	char		*filename			     **
468  |  ** 									     **
469  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
470  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
471  |  ** 									     **
472  |  **   Attached Globals:	line		Input read buffer		     **
473  |  ** 									     **
474  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
475  |  ++++*/
476  | 
477  | int	 Execute_TclFile(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
478  | 		     		char		*filename)
479  | {
480  |     FILE	*infile;
481  |     int		 gotPartial = 0;
482  |     int		 result = 0;
483  |     EM_RetVal	 em_result = EM_OK;
484  |     char	*cmd;
485  |     Tcl_DString	 cmdbuf;
486  | 
487  |     /**
488  |      **  If there isn't a line buffer allocated so far, do it now
489  |      **/
490  |     if( line == NULL) {
491  |         if( NULL == (line = (char*) module_malloc(LINELENGTH * sizeof(char)))) {
492  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
493  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
494  |         }
495  |     }
496  | 
497  |     /**
498  |      **  If we're supposed to be interpreting from stdin, set infile 
499  |      **  equal to stdin, otherwise, open the file and interpret
500  |      **/
501  | 
502  |     if( !strcmp( filename, _fil_stdin)) {
503  | 	infile = stdin;
504  |     } else {
505  | 	if( NULL == (infile = fopen( filename, "r"))) {
506  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPEN, LOC, filename,
507  | 		_(em_reading), NULL))
508  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
509  | 	}
510  |     }
511  |     
512  |     /**
513  |      **  Allow access to which file is being loaded.
514  |      **/
515  | 
516  |     linenum = 0;
517  |     Tcl_SetVar( interp, "ModulesCurrentModulefile", filename, 0);
518  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
519  |     
520  |     while( 1) {
521  | 
522  |         linenum++;
523  | 	if( fgets(line, LINELENGTH, infile) == NULL) {
524  | 	    if( !gotPartial) {
525  | 		break;	/** while **/
526  | 	    }
527  | 	    line[0] = '\0';
528  | 	}
529  | 	
530  | 	/**
531  | 	 **  Put the whole command on the command buffer
532  | 	 **/
533  | 
534  | 	cmd = Tcl_DStringAppend( &cmdbuf, line, (-1));
535  | 	
536  | 	if( line[0] != 0  && !Tcl_CommandComplete(cmd)) {
537  | 	    gotPartial++;
538  | 	    continue;
539  | 	}
540  | 	
541  | 	/**
542  | 	 **  Now evaluate the command and react on its result
543  | 	 **  Reinitialize the command buffer
544  | 	 **/
545  | 
546  |         result = Tcl_Eval( interp, cmd);
547  | 
548  | 	if( EM_ERROR == (em_result = ReturnValue(interp, result))) {
549  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_EXEC, LOC, cmd, NULL);
550  | 	}
551  | 
552  | 	Tcl_DStringTrunc( &cmdbuf, 0);
553  | 
554  |         switch( result) {
555  | 
556  |             case TCL_OK:	gotPartial = 0;
557  | 			        continue;	/** while **/
558  | 	    
559  |             case TCL_ERROR:	interp->errorLine = ((linenum-1)-gotPartial) +
560  | 				    interp->errorLine;
561  | 	    			/* FALLTHROUGH */
562  | 
563  |             case TCL_LEVEL0_RETURN:
564  | 	    			break;	/** switch **/
565  | 	}
566  | 
567  | 	/**
568  | 	 **  If the while loop hasn't been continued so far, it is to be broken
569  | 	 **  now
570  | 	 **/
571  | 
572  | 	break;	/** while **/
573  | 
574  |     } /** while **/
575  | 
576  |     /**
577  |      **  Free up what has been used, close the input file and return the result
578  |      **  of the last command to the caller
579  |      **/
580  | 
581  |     Tcl_DStringFree( &cmdbuf);
582  |     if( EOF == fclose( infile))
583  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, filename, NULL))
584  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
585  | 
586  |     return( result);
587  | 
588  | } /** End of 'Execute_TclFile' **/
589  | 
590  | /*++++
591  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
592  |  ** 									     **
593  |  **   Function:		CallModuleProcedure				     **
594  |  ** 									     **
595  |  **   Description:	Call a Tcl Procedure				     **
596  |  **			Executes the passed modulefile (conditionally hidden)**
597  |  **			and then evaluates the passed Tcl procedure	     **
598  |  ** 									     **
599  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
600  |  ** 									     **
601  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
602  |  **			Tcl_DString	*cmdptr		Buffer fot the Tcl   **
603  |  **							command		     **
604  |  **			char		*modulefile	According module file**
605  |  **			char		*procname	Name of the Tcl Proc.**
606  |  **			int		 suppress_output  Controlls redirect.**
607  |  **							of stdout and stderr **
608  |  ** 									     **
609  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
610  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
611  |  ** 									     **
612  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
613  |  ** 									     **
614  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
615  |  ++++*/
616  | 
617  | int  CallModuleProcedure(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
618  | 			 	Tcl_DString	*cmdptr,
619  | 			 	char		*modulefile,
620  | 			 	char		*procname,
621  | 			 	int		 suppress_output)
622  | {
623  |     char 	 cmdline[ LINELENGTH];
624  |     char	*cmd;
625  |     int          result;
626  |     int          saved_stdout = 0, saved_stderr = 0, devnull;
627  | 
628  |     /**
629  |      **  Must send stdout and stderr to /dev/null until the 
630  |      **  ModulesHelp procedure is called.
631  |      **/
632  |     if( suppress_output) {
633  | 	if( 0 > (devnull = open( _fil_devnull, O_RDWR))) {
634  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPEN, LOC, _fil_devnull,
635  | 		_(em_read_write), NULL))
636  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
637  | 	}
638  | 	
639  | 	/**
640  | 	 **  Close STDOUT and reopen it as /dev/null
641  | 	 **/
642  | 
643  | 	if( -1 == ( saved_stdout = dup( 1)))
644  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
645  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
646  | 	
647  | 	if( -1 == close( 1))
648  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
649  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
650  | 
651  | 	if( -1 == dup( devnull))
652  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_devnull, NULL))
653  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
654  | 	
655  | 	/**
656  | 	 **  Close STDERR and reopen it as /dev/null
657  | 	 **/
658  | 
659  | 	if( -1 == ( saved_stdout = dup( 2)))
660  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
661  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
662  | 	
663  | 	if( -1 == close( 2))
664  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
665  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
666  | 
667  | 	if( -1 == dup( devnull))
668  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_devnull, NULL))
669  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
670  |     }
671  | 
672  |     /**
673  |      **  Read the passed module file
674  |      **/
675  | 
676  |     Read_Modulefile( interp, modulefile);
677  | 
678  |     /**
679  |      **  Reinstall stdout and stderr
680  |      **/
681  | 
682  |     if( suppress_output) {
683  | 
684  | 	/**
685  | 	 **  Reinstall STDOUT
686  | 	 **/
687  | 
688  | 	if( EOF == fflush( stdout))
689  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_FLUSH, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
690  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
691  | 
692  | 	if( EOF == fflush( stderr))
693  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_FLUSH, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
694  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
695  | 	
696  | 	if( -1 == close( 1))
697  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
698  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
699  | 
700  | 	/**
701  | 	 **  Reinstall STDERR
702  | 	 **/
703  | 
704  | 	if( -1 == dup( saved_stdout))
705  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stdout, NULL))
706  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
707  | 	
708  | 	if( -1 == close( 2))
709  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
710  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
711  | 	
712  | 	if( -1 == dup( saved_stderr))
713  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_DUP, LOC, _fil_stderr, NULL))
714  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
715  |     }	
716  | 
717  |     /**
718  |      **  Now evaluate the Tcl Procedure
719  |      **/
720  | 
721  |     /* sprintf( cmdline, "%s\n", procname); */
722  |     strcpy( cmdline, procname);
723  |     strcat( cmdline, "\n");
724  |     cmd = Tcl_DStringAppend( cmdptr, cmdline, (-1));
725  | 
726  |     result = Tcl_Eval( interp, cmd);
727  |     Tcl_DStringTrunc( cmdptr, 0);
728  | 
729  |     return( result);
730  | 
731  | } /** End of 'CallModuleProcedure' **/
